interpGrp.interp: Changes in spelling or orthography. This includes any alterations to how words are written without affecting their meaning, such as standardizing spelling or correcting errors. Also includes adding or removing an alif as a marker of the accusative or at the end of a plural verb. Changes to the diacritics for a final ي or ى can be ignored. If the change affects the meaning or grammatical function of the word (such as the form of a verb), then it is more significant than an orthographic change and should not be in this category.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single minor word or part of a word. A minor word means a conjunction, pronoun, demonstrative pronoun (e.g. ذلك), pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, interrogative particle (such as 'ما') or other particle (such as 'قد'). This includes the expansion or contraction of a word and changes to verb form, such as modifications in verb tense, form, or voice, including changes to person or number and transformations between participle and verb. If the root word is the same but the number changes, then it falls in this category. It can still be in this category if the change affects the meaning substantially, so long as it is only affecting the part of speech described here or it does not change the root of the word. If there are changes to multiple words between readings (even if they are minor), then it should not be in this category but it is under 'Multiple_Word_Changes'. If there are multiple minor changes to a single word, then it can still be a Single_Minor_Word_Change.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single word that is more significant than a conjunction, pronoun, pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, or particle (such as 'قد'). It is only a major word change if the root of the word is different. If a word is changed to a different form of the same root, then it is a Single_Minor_Word_Change. If the two readings are identical except for a difference in a single major word, then it is in this category (even if the readings otherwise contain multiple words).

Changes across more than one word. Words can be major or minor. Even if the changes are minor, if multiple words are changed, then it falls in this category. If more than one word is added or omitted, then it is in this category.

app.rdg: قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود
قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه

relation.desc: Several words are added.
More than one word is changed because by transposing اليهود it also affects the ل preposition.

This change involves the addition of multiple words, specifically "قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود," which constitutes a significant alteration to the text as it introduces new content rather than modifying existing words. Since more than one word is added, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود

This change involves the addition of multiple words: "قال الرب" and "للذين اتو اليه من اليهود," which collectively constitute more than one word being added to the text. Therefore, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود

The change involves the omission of the final alif in the word اتوا, which is a spelling alteration that does not affect the meaning of the sentence. This fits the definition of orthographic changes, as it is a standardization of spelling without altering the grammatical function or meaning of the word.
c.f. قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
Several words are added.

The entire phrase "فكلمهم ايضا يسوع" is omitted, which constitutes the removal of a significant word (يسوع) along with its associated context. Since this phrase represents a complete thought and includes a major word (يسوع), its omission qualifies as a Single_Major_Word_Change. The change affects the meaning of the text significantly, as it removes the subject and action from the sentence.
c.f. فكلمهم ايضا يسوع ➞ OMIT
A single major word is added.
Two words are added.
The change involves the addition of the word صوته along with the word وقال. Since there are multiple words being added in this variation, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. وقال ➞ صوته وقال
The pronoun هو is added which is a minor word.

The change involves the substitution of the preposition "الي" with "فى," which does not alter the meaning of the phrase but rather represents a spelling variation in the use of the preposition. This aligns with the definition of orthographic changes, where the spelling or orthography is modified without affecting the overall meaning. The change from "الي" to "فى" is a standardization of the preposition used in this context.
c.f. يمشي في الظلمه الي ➞ يمشي فى الظلمه
The preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to له.
The preposition ل is added to الدهر.
The change involves two words: "الابد" is replaced with "الدهر," and "معه" is replaced with "له." Since both changes affect different words, this falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون له

The change involves multiple words: "الابد" is replaced with "الدهر," "تكون" is changed to "يكون," and "معه" is replaced with "له." Since more than one word is altered, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

The change involves substituting the major word الابد with الدهر, which alters the root of the word. This fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, as it is a significant alteration to a single word that affects the meaning of the phrase.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

The change involves multiple words: "الابد" is replaced with "للدهر," and "معه" is changed to "له." Both changes affect the meaning and involve different words, thus falling under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change involves the verb form from تكون to يكون, which is a modification in verb tense or form. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it affects a single minor word (the verb) without altering the root of the word. The change does not involve multiple words or a significant alteration in meaning.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون له ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

The change involves two words: the verb "يكون" is changed to "تكون," which is a significant alteration in verb form (from masculine singular to feminine singular), and the preposition "له" is changed to "معه," which alters the meaning and grammatical function of the phrase. Since both changes affect multiple words, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

The change involves the addition of the preposition ل before الدهر and the alteration of the verb يكون to تكون. The addition of the preposition ل is a minor change, and the change from يكون to تكون is a modification in verb form, which is also considered a minor change as it does not alter the root of the word. Therefore, this fits the criteria for a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change involves two words: the addition of the preposition ل before الدهر, and the change of the preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه to له. Since there are changes across more than one word, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change involves the addition of the major word نور (light) to the phrase, which alters the meaning significantly by introducing a new concept. The root of the word الحياه (life) remains the same, but the addition of نور creates a new phrase that conveys a different idea, thus qualifying as a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. الحياه ➞ نور الحياه

The addition of the preposition "الي" is a minor word change, as it is a preposition that does not alter the root of any major word in the sentence. This aligns with the definition provided for Single_Minor_Word_Change, which includes the addition of a conjunction, preposition, or other minor word.
c.f. OMIT ➞ الي
The pronoun انت is added and an alif is added to تشهد.
A ب preposition is add to حق.
The orthographic change is made to يسوع making it ايسوع and the ف conjunction is changed to a و.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
The spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع.
The verb اجاب is added and the phrase فقال لهم is moved to the end. The conjunction ف is changed to a و.

The change involves multiple words: "اجاب" is omitted, and "يسوع" is changed to "ايسوع," which constitutes a spelling variation. Since more than one word is affected, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. اجاب يسوع فقال لهم ➞ فقال لهم ايسوع

The spelling of ايسوع is changed to يسوع, which is a change in orthography without affecting the meaning of the text. This aligns with the definition of orthographic changes, as it involves standardizing the spelling of a name.
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب يسوع وقال لهم

The change involves the substitution of the conjunction "وقال" with "فقال," which is a minor word change as it only affects the conjunction without altering the overall meaning of the phrase. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, where a minor word is substituted.
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

The change involves the addition of the word "اجاب" and the substitution of "فقال" with "اجاب," which constitutes changes across multiple words. Therefore, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. فقال لهم ايسوع ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

The spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع, which is a change in orthography without affecting the meaning of the text. This aligns with the definition of the Orthography category, as it involves alterations to how a word is written.
c.f. اجاب يسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم
The conjunction و is added.
The preposition هي is added.

app.rdg: من اين انا والى اين انطلق فاما انتم
من اين انا والي اين اذهب واما انتم
اين اتيت ولا الى اين انطلق
اين اتيت ولا الي اين اذهب

relation.desc: Multiple words are changed.

The phrase ⸂وانتم انما⸃ is reduced to just ⸂انتم⸃, which involves the omission of the minor words و (and) and انما (indeed). These words are conjunctions and particles that do not significantly alter the meaning of the core subject (انتم). This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it involves the omission of minor words without changing the root or major components of the phrase.
c.f. وانتم انما ➞ انتم
The major word تقظون is omitted.

The phrase ⸂ايما تقضون⸃ is a significant part of the sentence, and its omission represents a major change in meaning. Since it is a complete phrase that conveys a specific idea, its removal qualifies as a Single_Major_Word_Change, as it alters the root meaning of the sentence.
c.f. ايما تقضون ➞ OMIT
The pronoun انتم is added.

The change involves the addition of the major word تقضوا, which is a verb form that significantly alters the meaning of the sentence. This is classified as a Single_Major_Word_Change because it introduces a new root word (قضى) that is different from the omitted text, thus affecting the overall meaning of the phrase.
c.f. OMIT ➞ تقضوا
The conjunction و is added.

The change involves the substitution of the conjunction "اما" with "و" in the phrase, which is a minor word change as it affects only a single minor word (the conjunction) without altering the root of the phrase. This aligns with the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, where changes to conjunctions or other minor words are classified.
c.f. اما انا ➞ وانا

The change involves the omission of the conjunction و and the addition of the pronoun انا, which is a minor word. The root of the word remains the same, and the change does not affect the overall meaning significantly, fitting the criteria for a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. واما انا ➞ وانا
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two changes occur. The conjunction ف is added at the start and the orthographic change occurs by addings an alif of nasb to احد.
Diacritics are added.
The conjunction ف is added at the start.

The change involves the addition of the conjunction ف at the beginning of the phrase, which is a minor word. Additionally, the word احد is changed to احدا by adding an alif of nasb, which is also considered a minor change. Since the root of the words remains the same and only minor elements are altered, it fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احدا

The change involves the addition of the conjunction ف at the beginning of the phrase, which is classified as a minor word change since it does not alter the root or grammatical structure of the main content of the phrase. This aligns with the definition provided for Single_Minor_Word_Change, where the addition of a conjunction is considered a minor alteration.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change involves the addition of the conjunction ف at the beginning of the phrase, which is classified as a minor word change according to the definitions provided. This aligns with the examples where a conjunction is added, such as "فقالوا → وقالوا" where the conjunction ف is changed to و. The root of the phrase remains the same, and only a minor word is altered.
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احدا

The change involves the substitution of the conjunction "ليس" with "فليس," which is a minor word change as it falls under the category of conjunctions. The root of the word "ادين" remains the same, and the overall meaning is not significantly altered. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, where only a minor word is altered without affecting the root or grammatical structure significantly.
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change involves the omission of the alif in the word احدا, which is a spelling alteration that does not affect the meaning of the phrase. This aligns with the definition of orthographic changes, as it is a standardization of spelling without altering the grammatical function or meaning of the word.
c.f. فليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change involves the omission of the alif of nasb in the word أحدًا, which is a spelling alteration that does not affect the meaning of the phrase. This aligns with the definition of orthographic changes, as it is a standardization of spelling without altering the grammatical function or meaning of the word.
c.f. فليس ادين احدًا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change involves replacing the single word ⸂لاني⸃ with two words ⸂هو لان⸃, which constitutes a change across more than one word. This aligns with the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, as it involves the addition of a pronoun (هو) and a conjunction (لان), thus affecting the overall structure of the phrase.
c.f. لاني ➞ هو لان
Changes occur to two words.
The form of لست is changed to ليست.
The form of ليست is changed to ليس.

The change involves substituting the verb form "لست" with "ليس," which is a modification of a single minor word (the verb) without altering the root of the word. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it affects the form of the verb but retains the same root.
c.f. لست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي

The change involves the verb form from "ليست" to "ليس," which is a modification in verb tense (from the feminine singular form to the masculine singular form). This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it affects a single minor word (the verb) without altering the root of the word.
c.f. ليست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي
The pronoun انا is added.
A pronominal suffix is added.
A و conjunction is omitted and pronominal suffix is added to a single word.

The change involves substituting the conjunction ولكن with لكن, which is a minor word. The root of the word remains the same, and the change does not affect the overall meaning of the sentence. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it is an alteration to a single minor word.
c.f. ولكني ➞ لكنى
Multiple words are added.
Multiple words are omitted.
Two words are added.

The word حق is a significant noun in this context, and its omission represents a major change in the text's meaning. Since it is a single word that has been removed, it fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. حق ➞ OMIT

The addition of the pronoun هي to the word حق constitutes a minor word change, as it involves the addition of a pronoun (which is classified as a minor word) to the existing word without altering its root or grammatical function. This aligns with the definition provided for Single_Minor_Word_Change, where the addition of a minor word is noted.
c.f. حق ➞ حق هي
The pronoun انا is omitted.
The pronoun (with conjunction) وانا is omitted.

The change involves the addition of the conjunction و to the minor word انا, which does not alter the root or the grammatical function of the word but simply expands it. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it is an addition to a single minor word.
c.f. انا ➞ وانا
The major word اشهد is omitted.
The preposition علي is omitted.

The word ⸂نفسى⸃ is a significant term in the context of the sentence, and its omission alters the meaning of the phrase. Since it is a major word that is being removed, this change falls under the category of Single_Major_Word_Change, as it affects the root meaning of the sentence.
c.f. نفسى ➞ OMIT

The change involves substituting the preposition "على" with "لي," which is a minor word change as both are prepositions and do not alter the root of the word. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, where a single minor word is substituted without affecting the overall meaning significantly.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي ذلك

The change involves replacing the phrase ⸂على ذلك⸃ with ⸂لي وهو⸃, which consists of two distinct words. This falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes as it involves changes across more than one word. The two phrases are not only different in terms of individual words but also in meaning, indicating a significant alteration in the text.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي وهو

The change involves substituting the minor word ذلك with وهو, which is a demonstrative pronoun. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it only affects a single minor word without altering the root or grammatical structure of the sentence. Similar examples include changes to conjunctions or minor pronouns.
c.f. لي ذلك ➞ لي وهو

The spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع, which is a change in orthography without affecting the meaning of the word. This aligns with the definition of the Orthography category, as it involves alterations to how the word is written.
c.f. يسوع ➞ ايسوع
Two words are omitted.
Two words are omitted.

The change involves substituting the conjunction ف with و in the phrase, which is a minor alteration that does not affect the overall meaning of the sentence. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it involves a substitution of a single minor word (the conjunction) without altering the root of the words involved.
c.f. فقال لهم ➞ وقال لهم
The preposition ب is added to هذا.

The change involves the verb "كان يكلمهم" being altered to "كلمهم," which represents a significant alteration in the verb form and meaning. The root of the verb changes from a compound form (كان يكلم) to a simple form (كلم), indicating a different action and grammatical structure. This aligns with the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, as the root of the word is different.
c.f. كان يكلمهم ➞ كلمهم
The noun الكنز is changed to القربان.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two words are changed.
The article ال is added.
Two words are changed.

The change involves the spelling of the word "ساعته" to "ساعه," which is a variation in orthography without affecting the meaning of the phrase. This aligns with the definition of orthographic changes, as it is a change in spelling that does not alter the grammatical function or meaning of the word.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان ساعه لم

The change involves the spelling of the word "ساعة," where the definite article "ال" is added, resulting in "الساعه." This is a change in orthography as it standardizes the spelling without altering the meaning of the phrase. Similar to the examples provided, such as adding or removing an alif or changing diacritics, this alteration does not affect the grammatical function or meaning of the word.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان الساعه لم

The change involves two words: "لان" is replaced with "اذ" and "ساعه" is replaced with "كانت". Since multiple words are altered in this transition, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. لان ساعه لم ➞ اذ كانت لم
Two words are changed.
The word بلغت is changed to اتت.
The verb اتت is changed to اقتربت.
c.f. تكون اقتربت ➞ تكن اتت

The change involves substituting the verb تكن (which means "to be" in the past tense) with اقتربت (which means "to approach" in the past tense). This is a significant alteration as it changes the root of the verb entirely, thus qualifying as a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. تكن بلغت ➞ تكون اقتربت

The change involves the verb form from تكون to تكن, which is a modification in the verb tense (from second person plural to second person singular). This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it affects a single minor word (the verb) without altering the root of the word. The change does not involve multiple words or a significant alteration in meaning beyond the grammatical form.
c.f. تكون اتت ➞ تكن اتت

The change involves substituting the verb "تكون" with "تكن," which is a different form of the same root, and replacing "اقتربت" with "اتت," which is a different verb entirely with a different root. This qualifies as a Single_Major_Word_Change because the root of the word has changed in the case of "اقتربت" to "اتت."

c.f. اذهب وتطلبوني وفي ➞ انطلق وتطلبونى ولا

The change involves the omission of the conjunction و at the beginning of the phrase, which is classified as a minor word. This aligns with the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, where an addition, omission, or substitution to a single minor word or part of a word is noted. In this case, the root word خطاياكم remains unchanged, and only the conjunction is affected.
c.f. وبخطاياكم ➞ خطاياكم

The change involves replacing the phrase ⸂خطاياكم⸃ with two new words ⸂تجدونى وباثمكم⸃, which constitutes a change across more than one word. The original phrase is replaced entirely, resulting in multiple new words being introduced, thus fitting the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. خطاياكم ➞ تجدونى وباثمكم

The change involves the verb form from تموتون to تموتوا, which is a modification in the verb tense or form but does not alter the root of the word. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it affects a single minor word (the verb) without changing its root.
c.f. تموتون وحيث ➞ تموتوا وحيث
The pronoun (with conjunction) فانتم is added.

The change involves substituting the verb انطلق (which means "to set out" or "to depart") with اذهب (which means "to go"). Since the root of the verb is different, this qualifies as a Single_Major_Word_Change according to the definitions provided.
c.f. انطلق انا ➞ اذهب انا

This change involves the substitution of the phrase ⸂اذهب انا⸃ with ⸂انطلق انا فانتم⸃, which consists of multiple words. The original phrase is replaced by a different verb (انطلق) and the addition of the pronoun (فانتم), resulting in a change across more than one word. Therefore, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. اذهب انا ➞ انطلق انا فانتم
The form of تاتون is changed to تاتوا.

The change involves multiple words: "ليس" is replaced with "لا," and "تاتون" is replaced with "تجون." Since there are changes across more than one word, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. ليس تقدرون تاتون ➞ لا تقدرون تجون

The change involves modifying the verb تقدرو to تقدرون, which is a change in the form of the verb affecting its number (from second person plural to second person plural with a different form). This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it is a modification to a single minor word (the verb) without altering the root of the word.
c.f. ليس تقدرو تاتوا ➞ ليس تقدرون تاتوا

The change involves multiple words: "ليس" is replaced with "لا," and "تاتوا" is replaced with "تجون." Since there are changes across more than one word, it falls under the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. ليس تقدرون تاتوا ➞ لا تقدرون تجون
The form of the verb قالوا is changed to قال

The change involves the addition of the interrogative particle ما, which is classified as a minor word. This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change since it is an addition of a single minor word without altering the root or grammatical structure of other words.
c.f. OMIT ➞ ما
The minor word ان is added.
The form of تاتوا is changed to تاتون.
The pronoun انتم is omitted.
The pronoun انتم is changed to ان and the form of the verb تاتون is changed to تاتوا. Both are minor changes but taken together, they are a changes to multiple words.

c.f. انتم تاتون ➞ ان تاتون

The change from تاتون to تحون involves a substitution of a single word where the root of the verb is different (تاتون vs. تحون). This aligns with the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, as it is not merely a minor alteration but a significant change in the verb's root.
c.f. انتم تاتون ➞ انتم تحون

The change involves modifying the verb form from تاتوا to تاتون, which is a change in the form of the verb affecting the number (from second person plural to second person plural with a different ending). This fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it involves a single minor word (the verb) and does not alter the root of the word.

The change involves the substitution of the word هو with the definite article ال, which is a minor word. The root of the word remains the same (الذي), and the change does not affect the grammatical function or meaning significantly, fitting the criteria for a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. هو الذي ➞ الذى

The change involves the transposition of two words: "هو" and "الذي," which alters their order in the phrase. This constitutes a change across more than one word, thus fitting the category of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. هو الذي ➞ الذي هو

The minor word ان is omitted, which fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it involves the removal of a single minor word without affecting the root of any major word. This is similar to the example where a minor word is omitted.
c.f. ان ➞ OMIT

The change involves substituting the word الابد with الدهر, which are different roots and carry different meanings. This qualifies as a major word change since the root of the word has changed from الابد (eternity) to الدهر (time/age).
c.f. الى الابد ➞ الى الدهر
